item.title: Comment on Velveteen Rabbit by Stephen Redwood
item.dc:creator: Stephen Redwood
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/velveteen-rabbit/#comment-176">Robin Mitchell</a>.
Hi Robin, Sorry about that. Was convinced I'd added a caption to them all, but it's not showing up and I can't seem to fix it. Have added a link to your site in the actual blog text instead.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Robin Mitchell.

Hi Robin, Sorry about that. Was convinced I’d added a caption to them all, but it’s not showing up and I can’t seem to fix it. Have added a link to your site in the actual blog text instead.

item.title: Comment on Velveteen Rabbit by Robin Mitchell
item.dc:creator: Robin Mitchell
item.description: Hi Stephen, could you credit the photographer please. Thanks.
item.content:encoded: Hi Stephen, could you credit the photographer please. Thanks.

item.title: Comment on We Will Not Shortly Have A Rasher On The Coals For Money by Stephen Redwood
item.dc:creator: Stephen Redwood
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/we-will-not-shortly-have-a-rasher-on-the-coals-for-money/#comment-2">Judy Bradshaw</a>.
Hi Judy. I'm glad you enjoyed the production. A good production of Shakespeare always brings out the story in ways I never thought it would - particularly when studying the text at school. There's such a difference between simply words on a page (although with Shakespeare those words carry a certain amount of gravitas) and a set, actors, lines and the stage.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Judy Bradshaw.

Hi Judy. I’m glad you enjoyed the production. A good production of Shakespeare always brings out the story in ways I never thought it would – particularly when studying the text at school. There’s such a difference between simply words on a page (although with Shakespeare those words carry a certain amount of gravitas) and a set, actors, lines and the stage.

item.title: Comment on We Will Not Shortly Have A Rasher On The Coals For Money by Judy Bradshaw
item.dc:creator: Judy Bradshaw
item.description: A truly wonderful professional production that really brought Shakespeare writing to life. Wish I could have seen this when I was studying the play at secondary school. I would have understood it so much more.
item.content:encoded: A truly wonderful professional production that really brought Shakespeare writing to life. Wish I could have seen this when I was studying the play at secondary school. I would have understood it so much more.
